intro: Urophyllum mindorense, commonly known as the Mindanao uruphylum, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Urophyllum mindorense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
